product.translation[0].definitions[0].de: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold
product.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The London factory assembles the finished product.
He works in marketing and product development.
product.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the number you get by multiplying two or more numbers in mathematics
product.translation[0].definitions[2].de: something that is produced through a natural or chemical process
product.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Hemoglobin is a product of red blood cells.
product.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: They help firms turn good ideas into commercial products.
Demand for consumer products has increased.
Do you know what chemicals are in household products such as washing powder and paint?
She doesn’t buy beauty products that have been tested on animals.
Some people are allergic to dairy products.
meat products like sausages, pies and burgers
The quality of the finished product is all-important.
The money will be used to fund product development.
We want to broaden the company’s product line.
product.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: something that is made or produced in large quantities, usually in order to be sold
consumer products such as mobile phones
dairy products
goods
things that are produced in order to be sold, especially for use in the home
They sell furniture and other household goods.
electrical goods
white goods (=large electrical goods used in the home such as washing machines and refrigerators)
commodity
a type of product or raw material that can be bought and sold – used especially about basic food products, metals, and fuels
The decline in prices for agricultural commodities made the economic situation worse.
All metal was a valuable commodity and was rarely wasted.
merchandise
things that are being sold, especially in shops
Customers are not allowed to handle the merchandise.
Sales of books, videos, and other merchandise have increased.
wares
things that are offered for sale, especially in a market or on the street
In the market, the traders began selling their wares.
Merchants brought their wares from all over the world.
export
a product that is sent to a foreign country in order to be sold
US exports rose to $11.935 billion.
At the moment, oil is their biggest export.
import
goods that are brought from one country into another to be sold there
The UK clothing industry cannot compete with foreign imports on price.
product.translation[1].definitions[0].de: something useful and intended to be sold that comes from nature or is made in a factory
product.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Distributors for Amway sell numerous products, including cleaning and personal-care products.
Companies must be able to launch new products (=introduce them) quickly and alter existing ones.
SL Industries designs, manufactures and distributes engineered products.
There were thought to be no safety problems, but the company decided to withdraw the product (=no longer make it available) so the incidents could be investigated.
product.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Corning produces glass fiber and other specialty glass products.
product.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The bank offers products such as cash management and short-term loans.
product.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: He needed $6,000 more a month to invest in inventory, but didn’t have it. As a result he couldn’t keep enough product on the shelf.
